content: in this legal case the tartu county court ruled in favor of the defendant after a 9month process the defendant has been ordered to pay procedural costs of €1824 the courts final resolution known as court dec replaces previous declarations of intent according to the civil code act the defendants are jointly responsible for the costs and must pay them within a specified deadline failure to do so may result in enforcement measures the defendants had the opportunity to submit a written response but failed to do so they can file an appeal against the default judgment within 30 days if they have a valid reason the appeal must be submitted to the tartu county court additionally an echo can be submitted within 30 days of becoming aware of the default judgment including necessary documents for the civil case if the claimant wishes to appeal it must be done within 30 days of receiving the decision and submitted to the tartu district court the courts judgment is based on the law succession act and the law property act which outline restrictions on asset distribution the procedural costs are determined based on the code civil procedure including state fees and legal aid costs in this case the defendant is required to pay a total of €2526 in state fees and justified expenses the claimants legal aid costs of nine hours totaling €1170 including vat are considered necessary and justified the court has ordered the defendant to pay the procedural costs late in accordance with the civil code
